title: Firefox könyvjelző problémák
content:
Tisztelt Ügyfélszolgálat.

Azért írnék Önöknek,mert mióta a rendszer frissítette a böngészőmet amit nagyon nagyon régóta használok egy olyan problémával kerültem szembe ami az eddig frissítések során nem volt. A probléma az lenne, hogy mikor megnyitom a könyvjelzőket és legörgetem egy bizonyos részig és új fület akarok megnyitni akkor az visszaugrik a legelejére és minden egyes pl videó keresésénél előröl kell kezdenem a könyvjelzőmegnyitást.

Ez a frissítés következménye?

Van e valami megoldás a dologra?

Válaszukat előre is köszönöm.

title: Scorretta visualizzazione del form di autenticazione al sito nexi.it
content: Buonasera. Da oggi ho problemi di accesso al form di autenticazione del network bancario Nexi, che gestisce la carta di credito. (https://www.nexi.it/login-titolari.html) Il form non mostra la classica checkbox che reca la scritta "Non sono un robot", per cui il pulsante "Accedi", nonostante l'immissione della password, resta ovviamente disabilitato. Nell'immagine allegata la freccia indica la zona in cui, normalmente, compariva la checkbox di cui ho parlato e che ora è misteriosamente sparita. Ho verificato che tale inconveniente non si presenta con l'ultima versione di Opera, tanto per fare un esempio, per cui non so se ascrivere il problema ai gestori web di Nexi. La versione di Firefox che sto usando è la più aggiornata (110.0 a 32 bit) ma il problema si è presentato anche con quella precedente. Grazie a tutti per ogni eventuale suggerimento. Maurizio

title: Alteração de comportamento ao usar leitor de código de barras no Firefox 110.0 (64 bits)
content:
Bom dia, equipe Mozilla!

Temos um sistema web de PDV/ERP que rodamos usando o Firefox.

Notamos que na versão 110.0, lançada no dia 14/02/23, ao usarmos o leitor de código de barras para "bipar" os produtos que serão vendidos no nosso caixa (PDV), está apresentando um comportamento diferente.

Normalmente, após a leitura do código de barras, o campo para digitar/ler o código do produto ficava selecionado após as leituras, possibilitando que continuássemos inserindo os outros itens da venda normalmente, sem intervenção.

Após esta atualização, quando lemos o código do produto, o "cursor" sai do campo onde temos que colocar o código e se precisarmos inserir outro produto, temos que clicar com o mouse dentro do campo de inserção novamente.

Fizemos o downgrade de versão para a 109.00, e ele trabalha como o esperado.

Tentei procurar alguma opção no "about:config" mas sem sucesso.

Gostaríamos de ajuda para corrigir este problema.
creator: gustavo_ti_village

title: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR
content:
hi there.

since yesterday i can't use firefox anymore (believe me, this is no exaggeration. i literally can't visit any website with the firefox browser). i tried to google my options on this issue, tried to clean cache, history, made recommended settings concerning DNS over HTTPS. i tried it with the adjustments in firefox about:config and set network.dns.disableIPv6 true - same with network.dns.disablePrefetch.

i even deinstalled the software and did a clean new install.i also tried deactivating antivirus and firewall.

nothing has helped so far.

any HTTPS site i want to call with firefox returns the PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR page, while with this browser (edge), on the same system (win10) via the same ISP any website works without any problems. i don't use a proxy and i don't use a VPN.

any ideas?

title: Firefox won't uninstall automatically via GPO
content:
Hello,

We have set up a GPO in our Active Directory environment for the install of Firefox which works great, however since at least version 90, we have had an issue where Firefox won't uninstall automatically when removing the computer object from the security group associated with the GPO. The box is ticked to "uninstall this application when it falls out of scope of management", which works for every other GPO we have created. The computer removes the assignment of the application, but does not then remove the application as it should.

Are you aware of this issue?

Thanks.

title: Restore previous session no longer fully working
content:
I always have two Firefox windows open: one for work, one for all the other stuff. The last two times I have restarted my computer (having closed Firefox before switching it off with a right click on the task bar icon and "close all windows"), only one of those windows has been restored. I didn't realise immediately either time, but when I clicked "recently closed windows" nothing happened, and there's no "restore previous session" option, either. I haven't been near my settings in months but I've checked and "startup" is indeed set to "open previous windows and tabs".

I found an article here talking about troubleshooting options and went to about:support but the article said to click on "show folder" in the Application Basics table and all I can see is "open folder"... twice (update folder and profile folder), and I'm not knowledgeable enough to feel comfortable going further.

Any help would be very welcome, thanks!

title: Mouse cursor does not disappear in fullscreen video playback, IF INVOKED FROM PiP
content:
Hi,

This might be an intended behavior (though it makes no sense to me), but there has to be at least a "about:config" option to force the mouse cursor hidden in this situation. Still, there is does not seem to be such an option there.

Is there a fix for this?

Thanks in advance.

title: Extensions gone after update
content: Firefox updated yestarday. I see these changes: extension are gone, theme settings were switched from Dark to Light, "Startup -> Open previous windows and tabs" option went from checked to unchecked. These things are still fine: bookmarks, saved passwords and history. Tried reverting to older Firefox version, but it didn't help so I installed the new one again. I then checked profiles in AppData folder and I see three of them. The problematic one I just described, the one that was automatically created when I tried to downgrade to previous Firefox version and the one which only contains empty "parent.lock" file. There is nothing useful in "Extensions" folders (first profile has addblock extension file which I just installed, second profile has langpack extension file). I don't particularly care about which specific extensions I used since I can just reinstall them when I need them again, but one of those extensions contained custom written scripts which were running on specific sites to help me with my work. Those scripts are what I really want to recover.

title: Having trouble with HTTPS Only Mode in latest version of Firefox 109.0.1
content:
Hello Gang - This problem has never occurred previously. Allow me to share --

Let me preface this question with a quick note: I use my Firefox Browser (V. 109.0.1) quite adequately and comfortably with the HTTPS Only mode set to "ON" all the time. (..thank you, btw..) To continue: I was recently sent a link from my antivirus company (Avast) for a discounted renewal for my account with them. This link was to a website called " digitalriver.com ". I was instructed by the sender that when using this link to access my 'discount', I would only have 1-Hour within which to complete my transaction or else the link would 'expire' and I would subsequently need to contact them once again for a 'new' link. "Not a problem!" I said to myself, as I confidently clicked the link and.. ..lo and behold, to my great surprise, when I clicked it, the site immediately threw up a 'security-window' (a 'frame' within the page) indicating that I could not access this site (the link) with my browser set to "HTTPS Only" mode. Somewhat miffed (and puzzled) I followed the included instructions on how to 'turn-off' this particular setting and yet once I did - Firefox immediately required me to "restart" the browser for this to take effect. Ultimately - this caused two issues... First, ..when i 'restarted' my Firefox browser, I lost my place in the page on "digitalriver.com", and was unable to 're-access' the link that I was sent.. ..and- Second, ..even though I have indeed changed my setting on the browser - all my pages still show up in the address-bar as "https://" rather than "http://" ...!?

Although I have sent an email to Avast regarding this issue, and hope for them to send me a New Link for the discount that was offered to me, I am troubled about how my browser has behaved since this time. I am also quite hesitant to do as suggested on Mozilla's help pages and - set my browser to "HTTPS Only" mode -but- adding an exception for this particular website, due to the instructions I received once I clicked on the link to 'digitalriver.com' which -again- stated explicitly to "turn-off" the HTTPS Only mode.

Please guys, what do you have to say about this particular dilemma I'm experiencing..?

Thank you in advance for your help,

Sincerely,

-Steven "Art" Slater 

                 .                             .
creator: ArtStud

title: How do I recover firefox(cache and cookies) ?
content:
I have not turn off the PC yet and just clear all the data last 2hours.

I tried this and it shows history only 1. Press Windows + R, type cmd and click OK. Or you can also type cmd in the Windows search bar. 2. Open Command Prompt, type ipconfig /displaydns, and press Enter. Now, you can see the recently visited websites. You can view, copy & paste the important websites into Firefox, and save them as bookmarks.
